trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory hybrid identity design considerations - determine multi-factor authentication requirements
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory hybrid identity design considerations - determine multi-factor authentication requirements

trans-unit.source: With Conditional access control, Azure Active Directory checks the specific conditions you pick when authenticating the user and before allowing access to the application.
trans-unit.target: With Conditional access control, Azure Active Directory checks the specific conditions you pick when authenticating the user and before allowing access to the application.

trans-unit.source: Once those conditions are met, the user is authenticated and allowed access to the application.
trans-unit.target: Once those conditions are met, the user is authenticated and allowed access to the application.

trans-unit.source: Determine multi-factor authentication requirements for your hybrid identity solution
trans-unit.target: Determine multi-factor authentication requirements for your hybrid identity solution

trans-unit.source: In this world of mobility, with users accessing data and applications in the cloud and from any device, securing this information has become paramount.
trans-unit.target: In this world of mobility, with users accessing data and applications in the cloud and from any device, securing this information has become paramount.

trans-unit.source: Every day there is a new headline about a security breach.
trans-unit.target: Every day there is a new headline about a security breach.

trans-unit.source: Although, there is no guarantee against such breaches, multi-factor authentication, provides an additional layer of security to help prevent these breaches.
trans-unit.target: Although, there is no guarantee against such breaches, multi-factor authentication, provides an additional layer of security to help prevent these breaches.

trans-unit.source: Start by evaluating the organizations requirements for multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Start by evaluating the organizations requirements for multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: That is, what is the organization trying to secure.
trans-unit.target: That is, what is the organization trying to secure.

trans-unit.source: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements for setting up and enabling the organizations users for multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements for setting up and enabling the organizations users for multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with MFA and what it does, it is strongly recommended that you read the article [What is Azure Multi-Factor Authentication?](multi-factor-authentication.md)
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with MFA and what it does, it is strongly recommended that you read the article [What is Azure Multi-Factor Authentication?](multi-factor-authentication.md)

trans-unit.source: prior to continue reading this section.
trans-unit.target: prior to continue reading this section.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to answer the following:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to answer the following:

trans-unit.source: Is your company trying to secure Microsoft apps?
trans-unit.target: Is your company trying to secure Microsoft apps?

trans-unit.source: How these apps are published?
trans-unit.target: How these apps are published?

trans-unit.source: Does your company provide remote access to allow employees to access on-premises apps?
trans-unit.target: Does your company provide remote access to allow employees to access on-premises apps?

trans-unit.source: If yes, what type of remote access?You also need to evaluate where the users who are accessing these applications will be located.
trans-unit.target: If yes, what type of remote access?You also need to evaluate where the users who are accessing these applications will be located.

trans-unit.source: This evaluation is another important step to define the proper multi-factor authentication strategy.
trans-unit.target: This evaluation is another important step to define the proper multi-factor authentication strategy.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Where are the users going to be located?
trans-unit.target: Where are the users going to be located?

trans-unit.source: Can they be located anywhere?
trans-unit.target: Can they be located anywhere?

trans-unit.source: Does your company want to establish restrictions according to the user’s location?
trans-unit.target: Does your company want to establish restrictions according to the user’s location?

trans-unit.source: Once you understand these requirements, it is important to also evaluate the user’s requirements for multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Once you understand these requirements, it is important to also evaluate the user’s requirements for multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: This evaluation is important because it will define the requirements for rolling out multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: This evaluation is important because it will define the requirements for rolling out multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Are the users familiar with multi-factor authentication?
trans-unit.target: Are the users familiar with multi-factor authentication?

trans-unit.source: Will some uses be required to provide additional authentication?
trans-unit.target: Will some uses be required to provide additional authentication?

trans-unit.source: If yes, all the time, when coming from external networks, or accessing specific applications, or under other conditions?
trans-unit.target: If yes, all the time, when coming from external networks, or accessing specific applications, or under other conditions?

trans-unit.source: Will the users require training on how to setup and implement multi-factor authentication?
trans-unit.target: Will the users require training on how to setup and implement multi-factor authentication?

trans-unit.source: What are the key scenarios that your company wants to enable multi-factor authentication for their users?
trans-unit.target: What are the key scenarios that your company wants to enable multi-factor authentication for their users?

trans-unit.source: After answering the previous questions, you will be able to understand if there are multi-factor authentication already implemented on-premises.
trans-unit.target: After answering the previous questions, you will be able to understand if there are multi-factor authentication already implemented on-premises.

trans-unit.source: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements for setting up and enabling the organizations users for multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements for setting up and enabling the organizations users for multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Does your company need to protect privileged accounts with MFA?
trans-unit.target: Does your company need to protect privileged accounts with MFA?

trans-unit.source: Does your company need to enable MFA for certain application for compliance reasons?
trans-unit.target: Does your company need to enable MFA for certain application for compliance reasons?

trans-unit.source: Does your company need to enable MFA for all eligible users of these application or only administrators?
trans-unit.target: Does your company need to enable MFA for all eligible users of these application or only administrators?

trans-unit.source: Do you need have MFA always enabled or only when the users are logged outside of your corporate network?
trans-unit.target: Do you need have MFA always enabled or only when the users are logged outside of your corporate network?

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Define a hybrid identity adoption strategy
